task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 247°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the building fully in view (including roofline) to estimate its height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The view is now facing north instead of the target’s southwest direction, so I should rotate back toward ~247° to reacquire the main building while keeping an upward pitch.
To estimate height reliably I need to see the roofline against the sky, so I will tilt up while keeping the building centered at 247°.
The camera keeps snapping back to 0° after tilting up, so I should rotate in yaw to ~247° while staying pitched up to capture the roof.
Since pitch resets when I look up, I should instead move to a better vantage point to see the full facade and infer the number of floors for a height estimate.
I need to face the target building at ~247° (southwest), so I should rotate left from 315° toward 247°.
I’m still west of the desired 247° view, so I should rotate further left by about 45° to face the building more directly.
The heading jumped back to 315° again, so I should use the explicit left-look option to get to 225° and then fine-tune toward 247°.
From 270° I need to rotate slightly right (~23°) to align with the target southwest heading around 247°.
There is an explicit option to face 247° directly, which matches the target building direction for the height estimate.
I need to reach ~247° from 270°, so I should rotate left by about 23° to align with the building direction.
The left-look preset will put me exactly at the desired 247° heading toward the target building.
Rotations seem to be snapping between fixed headings, so I should move to a node that likely gives a clearer view of the main building to estimate its floors and height.
To face the building at ~247°, I should first rotate left to 225° and then fine-tune right about 22°.
Since I can’t reliably dial to 247°, I will estimate from what’s visible at 270°: the main building appears ~3 stories (typical ~3.3 m/story plus roof/parapet).
